excerpt: Museum featuring an outdoor sculpture park & some indoor exhibits, plus a natural hot spring.
detail_description: The Hakone Open-Air Museum, established in 1966, aims to blend nature and art seamlessly. It spans across 77,000 acres of Japanese countryside and showcases an extensive collection from renowned international and local artists such as Miro, Rodin, and Yoshitatsu Yanagihara. The museum features outdoor sculptures by notable artists like Henry Moore and Barbara Hepworth set against the backdrop of Hakone's lush hills.
name: The Hakone Open-Air Museum
address: 1121 Ninotaira, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0493, Japan

excerpt: Historic Japanese Shinto shrine with a small museum in a verdant lakefront setting.
detail_description: Hakone Shrine is a historic Shinto shrine located in a lush lakeside setting. It features a small museum and is known for its iconic red torii gate that can be spotted from the waters of Lake Ashi. The shrine is believed to bring luck in battle and has been revered by prominent historical figures like shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu and ruler Minamoto no Yoritomo.
name: Hakone Shrine
address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Aerial sightseeing gondola ride above a valley of steaming volcanic craters.
detail_description: The Hakone Ropeway offers a breathtaking aerial gondola ride above a valley of volcanic craters. This 4km route from Tougendai station to Sounzan station passes through the Hakone mountains, providing ever-changing views of nature throughout the seasons. From cherry blossoms to red and yellow leaves, the scenery is stunning. On clear days, Mount Fuji can be seen in the distance.
name: Hakone Ropeway
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Sightseeing cruises are offered on this scenic crater lake with a campsite & nearby hiking trails.
detail_description: Lake Ashi, also known as Ashinoko, is a picturesque crater lake located in Hakone, west of Tokyo. Visitors can enjoy sightseeing cruises on the lake and explore nearby hiking trails and campsites. The area offers various ways to take in the stunning scenery, including onboard Hakone Sightseeing Cruises or from the shores of Lake Ashi. Additionally, visitors can experience breathtaking views from the Hakone Ropeway gondola or while relaxing in hot springs.
name: Lake Ashi
address: Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Weekend tourists pack the Owakudani valley, known for its steaming sulfur vents at Mount Hakone's base. Souvenir shops and a food court at the visitors' center offer kuro-tamago — black-shelled eggs boiled in volcanic hot springs. On clear days, cable car rides on the Hakone Ropeway feature panoramic Mount Fuji views. Near the station, hikers can follow a scenic trail leading to the summit of Mount Kamiyama.
detail_description: Owakudani, located at the base of Mount Hakone, is a popular destination for weekend tourists. The valley is famous for its steaming sulfur vents and visitors can enjoy kuro-tamago, black-shelled eggs boiled in volcanic hot springs, at the souvenir shops and food court in the area. On clear days, tourists can take cable car rides on the Hakone Ropeway to enjoy panoramic views of Mount Fuji.
name: Owakudani
address: Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Western-style hillside botanical garden with a tea house, greenhouses & a central fountain.
detail_description: Hakone Gōra Park is a stunning Western-style hillside botanical garden located in Hakone. This French-style landscape park offers a picturesque retreat throughout the year, showcasing vibrant azaleas and cherry blossoms in spring, blooming hydrangeas around the central fountain in summer, and a breathtaking display of red and orange maple leaves in autumn. During winter, the park transforms with enchanting Christmas lights. Visitors can also enjoy scenic views of Mt.
name: Hakone Gora Park
address: 1300 Gora, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

excerpt: European & Japanese art in a serene modern museum that's mostly underground & offers a forest trail.
detail_description: Nestled in the serene natural beauty of Hakone, Japan, the Pola Museum of Art is a modern museum that boasts a unique underground design and offers visitors a forest trail experience. Established in 2002 by the Pola Art Foundation, this museum showcases an impressive private art collection amassed over 40 years by Tsuneshi Suzuki.
name: Pola Museum of Art
address: Japan, 〒250-0631 Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo District, Hakone, Sengokuhara, 小塚山１２８５

detail_description: The Hakone Museum of Art showcases an exclusive collection of Japanese artwork, featuring ancient ceramics from prehistoric times to the Edo Period. The museum's founder, Mokichi Okada, skillfully designed beautiful traditional gardens that perfectly embody the essence of true Japanese aesthetics. These gardens can be best appreciated in November when the vibrant autumn foliage adds a colorful touch to the lush natural surroundings.
name: Hakone Museum of Art
address: 1300 Gora, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

excerpt: Visitors can enjoy Mt. Fuji views & eat black eggs boiled in hot springs at this geothermic site.
detail_description: Owakudani, also known as Hell Valley, is a geothermic site in Hakone that offers stunning views of Mt. Fuji and the surrounding area. Visitors can take the Hakone Tozan Railway or local buses from Hakone-Yumoto Station to reach this forested and mountainous area. One of the main attractions here is the opportunity to eat black eggs boiled in hot springs, which are said to add seven years to your life for each egg consumed.
name: Owakudani
address: 1251 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

excerpt: Charming museum on scenic grounds featuring Venetian glassware, plus a gift shop & Italian eatery.
detail_description: Nestled in a picturesque setting, the Hakone Venetian Glass Museum, also known as Hakone Garasu no Mori or Hakone Glass Forest, is a delightful museum that focuses on Venetian glassware. It boasts an impressive collection of exquisite glass pieces from various periods, with a special emphasis on those from the Venetian Renaissance.
name: Hakone Venetian Glass Museum (Glass Forest)
address: 940-48 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

excerpt: Museum of Japanese, Chinese & Korean art set in a woodland area with streams, paths & hot springs.
detail_description: Nestled in a serene woodland area with streams and hot springs, the Okada Museum of Art showcases an extensive collection of Japanese, Chinese, and Korean cultural treasures. Opened in 2013, this museum houses a diverse array of early-modern Japanese paintings, East Asian ceramics, and Buddhist sacred statues dating back to the 11th century. The modern building seamlessly integrates into its natural surroundings while providing over 5,000 square meters of exhibition space across five floors.
name: Okada Museum of Art
address: 493-1 Kowakudani, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0406, Japan

excerpt: Hakone, in Japan's Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park west of Tokyo, is a mountainous town known for its hot springs resorts (onsen) and views of the iconic volcano Mount Fuji. It also encompasses Hakone Shrine, a Shinto shrine with a red “torii” gate overlooking Lake Ashi, which can be toured by boat, as well as the boiling sulphur springs of the Owakudani Valley.
detail_description: Nestled within the breathtaking Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, Hakone is a charming mountainous town located just west of Tokyo. Renowned for its rejuvenating hot springs and stunning views of Mount Fuji, this destination offers visitors a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural experiences. One must-see attraction is the Hakone Shrine, famous for its striking red torii gate that gracefully overlooks Lake Ashi.
name: Hakone
address: Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Former imperial palace complex offering walking paths & an observation platform with scenic views.
detail_description: Onshi-Hakone Park, located on Togashima Island south of Lake Ashi, was once a summer retreat for aristocrats and a state guest house. Covering approximately 15.9 hectares, the park boasts various types of sakura trees, particularly mame sakura, which bloom during spring around Mount Fuji and Hakone. The former Imperial villa on a small peninsula offers stunning views of the lake and surrounding mountains, including Mount Fuji.
name: Onshi-Hakone Park
address: 171 Motohakone, 箱根町 Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Opened in 1988, this art museum features Nihonga-style paintings, city views, a cafe & gardens.
detail_description: Narukawa Art Museum, established in 1988, is a private art museum offering a stunning panoramic view of Lake Ashi. The museum houses an impressive collection of over 4,000 modern and renowned Japanese paintings, ranging from works by esteemed artists like Kyujin Yamamoto and Ikuo Hirayama to pieces by emerging talents. The exhibitions are refreshed seasonally to provide visitors with diverse experiences throughout the year.
name: Narukawa Art Museum
address: 570 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Edo-era military checkpoint featuring soldiers' quarters, a lookout, a tea room & more.
detail_description: Hakone Checkpoint, located in Hakone-Machi, is a replica of a guardhouse from the Edo era used to inspect travelers and goods along the Tokaido Highway. The site also features remnants of the old highway lined with ancient cedars. History enthusiasts will appreciate its significance as an important site for transportation and communication during the Edo period.
name: Hakone Checkpoint
address: 1番地 Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

excerpt: A popular base for visitors, Yumoto features hot spring resorts along the Sukumo and Haya rivers. From Hakone-Yumoto Station, the charming red trains of the Hakone Tozan Railway wind through forested valleys and over mountain bridges on the short ride to Gora village. Souvenir stores sell traditional wooden boxes with intricate mosaic patterns, and there are teahouses, snack bars, and noodle shops on the riverbanks.
detail_description: Yumoto is a popular destination known for its hot spring resorts situated along the Sukumo and Haya rivers. The area is easily accessible from Hakone-Yumoto Station, where visitors can embark on a picturesque train journey through forested valleys to Gora village. Yumoto offers traditional wooden souvenirs, teahouses, snack bars, and noodle shops along the riverbanks.
name: Yumoto
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0311, Japan

detail_description: The Hakone Tozan Railway provides easy access to Ashinoko, a renowned destination offering stunning views of Mount Fuji and the iconic red torii gate of Hakone Shrine. Travelers can reach Ashinoko via the Hakone Ropeway from Hakone. It's important to consider that cloudy or rainy weather may obstruct the mountain view, but on clear days, visitors can capture breathtaking photographs of the picturesque scenery.
name: Hakone Tozan Railway
address: Kanagawa, Japan

excerpt: Relaxed hot spring hotel with dining & a spa, plus waterslides, a wine bath & an indoor pool.
detail_description: Hakone Kowakien Yunessun is a hot spring hotel offering a unique experience with its themed pools and water attractions. Divided into two areas, Yunessun requires bathing suits while Mori No Yu offers traditional hot spring baths without them. The resort features the Rodeo Mountain waterslide, designed to resemble rapids, as well as family-friendly onsen experiences.
name: Hakone Kowakien Yunessun
address: 1297 Ninotaira, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0407, Japan

excerpt: Traditional onsen baths ringed by forest, with indoor & outdoor pools, a garden & a restaurant.
detail_description: Hakone Yuryo is a mountainside day spa located in Hakone, Japan. It offers traditional onsen baths surrounded by lush forest, including indoor and outdoor pools as well as pottery baths. The facility also features a garden, a restaurant, sauna facilities, and massage services. Visitors can take advantage of the free shuttle bus from Hakone-Yumoto train station to access the spa. Additionally, private baths can be booked in advance for those seeking a more exclusive experience.
name: Hakone Yuryo
address: 4 Tonosawa, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0315, Japan

excerpt: Scenic mountain region known for its fields of pampas grass, museums & a botanical garden.
detail_description: Sengokuhara, a district of Hakone in Kanagawa Prefecture, is renowned for its stunning pampas grass fields that are especially captivating during the autumn season. The area features open fields of golden pampas grass, meticulously maintained through controlled burning in spring to ensure their pristine condition. Sengokuhara Plateau offers various attractions such as the silver grass meadow, Sengokuhara Marsh, and Hakone Wetland Flower Garden.
name: Sengokuhara
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

excerpt: Museum in scenic surrounds with glass objects & jewelry by René Lalique, plus a stylish restaurant.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Sengokuhara area, the Hakone "Rene Lalique" Museum is a sophisticated destination showcasing an impressive collection of over 1,500 pieces by renowned French artist Rene Lalique. Visitors can marvel at the intricately designed glassware, perfume bottles, and jewelry that epitomize Art Nouveau elegance. The museum also features a stylish restaurant offering delectable French cuisine and a meticulously manicured Japanese garden for leisurely strolls.
name: Lalique Museum, Hakone
address: 186-1 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

detail_description: Nestled just a short stroll from Gora Station, GORA BREWERY & GRILL is a chic brewery restaurant that beautifully marries the art of Japanese cuisine with craft beer. Established in 2017 by the illustrious chef Nobuyuki Matsuhisa, known for his innovative fusion dishes, this venue boasts an inviting ambiance characterized by modern Japanese aesthetics and striking red walls.
name: GORA BREWERY&GRILL
address: 1300-72 Gora, Hakone, Ashigarakami District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

detail_description: The Hakone Pirate Ship Tōgendai Port offers a unique and memorable experience for visitors. From the former Hakone Port, now known as Moto-Hakone Port, tourists can enjoy stunning sights such as Lake Ashi and Mount Fuji. The still, crystal-clear surface of Lake Ashi provides a mesmerizing reflection of Mount Fuji, especially in the early morning mist.
name: Hakone Pirate Ship Tōgendai Port
address: 164 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Cafe for sweet & savory pastries, plus a restaurant for burgers & sandwiches, both with lake views.
detail_description: Bakery & Table Hakone is a charming cafe and restaurant located by the picturesque Lake Ashi. The establishment offers a delightful selection of sweet and savory pastries, as well as a menu featuring delectable burgers and sandwiches. Guests can enjoy stunning views of the lake while indulging in an array of freshly baked bread, cakes, jams, dips, sauces, and beverages available at the take-out bakery on the ground floor.
name: Bakery & Table Hakone
address: ９-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Passenger pier for lake cruises with Mt. Fuji views aboard a multi-deck pleasure boat.
detail_description: Lake Ashi Pleasure Boat Moto-hakone Port is a popular spot for embarking on scenic lake cruises with stunning views of Mt. Fuji. Visitors can choose from various types of watercraft, including multi-deck pleasure boats and pirate ships that offer different experiences. The regular sightseeing boat provides a spacious and panoramic view, with the option to disembark at two stops along the way. Additionally, peddle boats are available for those who prefer a more hands-on boating experience.
name: Lake Ashi Pleasure Boat Moto-hakone Port
address: 45-3 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Traditional Japanese baths with a range of pools & a waterfall in serene quarters.
detail_description: Tenzan Onsen is a highly recommended traditional Japanese bath located in Hakone, just a short bus ride from Hakone Yumoto station. Surrounded by lush trees and vines, it offers a serene retreat away from the bustling energy of Tokyo. The facility features various pools, including a waterfall, and is nestled in the mountains, providing guests with stunning views of bamboo forests during summer and vibrant autumn foliage.
name: Tenzan Onsen
address: 208 Yumotochaya, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0312, Japan

excerpt: Ancient Buddhist temple with a cemetery & wooded gardens featuring more than 200 disciple statues.
detail_description: Choanji is an ancient Buddhist temple located in a serene setting surrounded by nature. Established in 1356, the temple features a cemetery and wooded gardens with over 200 disciple statues. The tranquil atmosphere of the bamboo forest adds to its majestic appeal. Visitors can stroll through the beautiful garden, which changes with the seasons, and admire the 500 Arhats, each displaying a unique facial expression.
name: Ryukozan Choanji 、 Sotoshu Hanano Temple
address: 82 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

detail_description: The Hakone Komagatake Ropeway is a scenic aerial tramway that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and Lake Ashi. It provides a convenient way to access the volcanic Owakudani valley and the Komagatake Ropeway Summit, where visitors can enjoy panoramic vistas of Mount Fuji on clear days. The ropeway ride itself is an exhilarating experience, with gondolas gliding smoothly through the air, providing an unforgettable journey above the stunning Hakone landscape.
name: Hakone Komagatake Ropeway
address: Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Tranquil village in lush surrounds with hiking trails, an open-air museum & hot springs.
detail_description: Miyanoshita is a serene village nestled in verdant surroundings, offering an escape into nature with its network of hiking trails and the allure of open-air museums. Situated within the Fuji Hakone Izu National Park, this idyllic retreat is one of seven hot spring towns in the area. When the skies are clear, visitors can marvel at the awe-inspiring sight of Mt. Fuji on the horizon, especially during winter from December to February.
name: Miyanoshita
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0404, Japan

excerpt: This picturesque area features rolling fields of pampas grass at the base of a mountain.
detail_description: Nestled at the foot of Mount Hakone, the Sengokuhara Susuki Grass Fields offer a stunning natural spectacle that captivates visitors with its vast expanses of pampas grass. From late September to early November, this enchanting landscape transforms into a shimmering sea of silver as the grass sways gracefully in the autumn breeze. Just a short 30-minute journey from Hakone-Yumoto Station, it’s an easily accessible gem for nature lovers and photographers alike.
name: Sengokuhara Susuki Grass Fields
address: Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

name: Peace Torii
address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Founded in 1976, this botanical garden features a variety of woodland & wetland plants.
detail_description: Hakone-en, established in 1976, is a diverse resort complex located on the shores of Lake Ashino at an elevation of 723 meters. It encompasses a botanical garden showcasing woodland and wetland plants, as well as Hakone-en Aquarium, the highest seawater aquarium in Japan. A major highlight is Baikal Seal Plaza, where visitors can observe adorable seals swimming and lounging by the water.
name: Hakone-en
address: 139 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

detail_description: Old Tōkaidō Road Ancient Cedar Avenue - East End is a 500-meter-long forest path lined with over 400 cedar trees, some of which are more than 350 years old. Planted to provide shade for travelers, these towering trees create a serene and comfortable atmosphere. The avenue stretches from Moto-Hakone to Onshi-Hakone Park and was originally planted in 1618 by Matsudaira Masatsuna.
name: Old Tōkaidō Road Ancient Cedar Avenue - East End
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

excerpt: Sightseeing destination for lake cruises on pirate-style ships with scenic mountain views.
detail_description: The Hakone Sightseeing Cruise offers a unique experience for travelers looking to explore the scenic landscapes of Hakone. This popular tourist attraction features pirate-style ships that take passengers on a cruise across Lake Ashi, providing stunning views of the surrounding mountains and the iconic Mount Fuji on clear days. The cruise serves as a convenient mode of transport between various stations and townships in Hakone, allowing visitors to enjoy the picturesque scenery while traveling between destinations.
name: Hakone Sightseeing Cruise
address: 161 Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

excerpt: Rural area featuring a lake with "pirate ship" cruises & a ropeway up Mount Komagatake.
detail_description: Motohakone is a charming rural area known for its picturesque lake and the unique experience of cruising on a 'pirate ship.' Visitors can also enjoy a scenic ropeway ride up Mount Komagatake, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.
name: Motohakone
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Botanical garden with wetland & alpine plants, plus seasonal flowers, indoor exhibits & a gift shop.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sengokuhara Onsen, Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands, also known as Hakone Shissei Kaen, is a captivating showcase of approximately 200 species unique to Japan's wetlands. The garden boasts an impressive collection of over 1,100 highland plants and various forest and grassland species.
name: Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands
address: 817 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

excerpt: Cheerful museum honoring the 100th anniversary of the book, "The Little Prince," & its author.
detail_description: Nestled in the highlands of Sengokuhara, The Little Prince Museum is a cheerful tribute to the 100th anniversary of 'The Little Prince' and its author, Antoine de Saint-Exupery. This museum beautifully brings to life the beloved children's tale through a charming French townscape and a picturesque European garden designed by Keiko Yoshiya.
name: Little Prince Museum
address: 909 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0631, Japan

detail_description: Gora Station is a key transportation hub in Hakone, providing access to popular attractions such as Ashi Lake and Mount Fuji. Visitors can reach Ashi Lake via the Hakone Ropeway or local buses, with accommodation options mainly concentrated on the eastern shore near the ropeway station. On clear days, stunning views of Mount Fuji can be enjoyed from this area.
name: Gora Station
address: Gōra, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

excerpt: Aquarium with freshwater & saltwater fish, plus a pond where visitors can watch seals swimming.
detail_description: Hakone-en Aquarium is a unique seawater aquarium located at a high altitude in Japan, boasting 32,000 fishes from 450 species worldwide. Visitors can enjoy underwater shows featuring divers feeding the fish in large tanks reaching up to seven meters tall. The aquarium includes the Baikal Seal Plaza, where rare freshwater Baikal seals from Russia can be observed, and the Seawater Pavilion and Freshwater Pavilion showcasing a diverse array of creatures.
name: Hakone-en Aquarium
address: 139 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

detail_description: Amida-ji Temple, also known as the Hydrangea Temple, dates back to the Edo period and was founded by Priest Tansei. The temple is renowned for its vibrant hydrangeas that bloom during the rainy season. Additionally, it holds historical significance as it is associated with Princess Kazu. Visitors seeking adventure can explore an unkempt trail behind the temple and discover a small cave or spring nearby.
name: Amida-ji Temple
address: 24 Tonosawa, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0315, Japan

excerpt: Hillside hot springs resort featuring traditional inns, gardens & the Hakone Museum of Art.
detail_description: Gora is a charming hillside hot springs resort in Hakone, known for its traditional inns, beautiful gardens, and the Hakone Museum of Art. As you leave the station and ascend a gentle slope, you'll come across a unique concept store that combines a photo studio with a cozy cafe. Originally named 'Shima Photograph Studio,' it exclusively operated as a photo studio when Gora Station first opened.
name: Gora
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

detail_description: The Hotoriya souvenir store provides an enjoyable experience with its delicious food and beautiful view of Lake Ashinoko. The store is spacious and clean, with friendly staff that makes it easy to spend time there. The seats by the window offer a wonderful view of the lake in any season, making it a worthwhile visit no matter what time of year you happen to be in the area.
name: Hotoriya
address: 161-1 Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0521, Japan

excerpt: Adventure park in a forested area with a ropes course, climbing wall & zip-line.
detail_description: Nestled in the stunning Sengokuhara region of Hakone, Forest Adventure Hakone is an exhilarating outdoor park that invites visitors to immerse themselves in nature while enjoying a variety of physical activities. This eco-friendly adventure park features a ropes course, climbing wall, and zip-line, all designed to engage with the towering trees that define the landscape.
name: Forest Adventure Hakone
address: Japan, 〒250-0311 Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo District, Hakone, Yumoto, 字茶の花749-1

detail_description: Nestled along the scenic route from Motohakone-ko to the historic Odakyu Hotel de Yama, Salon de Thé Rosage offers a delightful escape that feels as if it’s floating on Lake Ashi. This charming dessert café is perfectly situated near Hakone-jinja Shrine, making it an ideal spot for a well-deserved break after exploring the shrine's beautiful grounds.
name: Salon de thé Rosage
address: 山のホテル別館, ８０ Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Picturesque caldera lake/resort area with boat tours, hot springs, accommodation & views of Mt Fuji.
detail_description: Nestled in the captivating Hakone region of Japan, Lake Ashi is a picturesque caldera lake that offers a serene retreat from urban life. The crystal-clear waters reflect the iconic Mt. Fuji, adding an ethereal touch to the landscape. Visitors can enjoy boat tours on the lake and explore hot springs while taking in breathtaking views of the surrounding nature. The area also offers accommodation options for those looking to extend their stay and immerse themselves in this idyllic setting.
name: Lake Ashi
address: Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

detail_description: Hakone Shrine 1st Torii Gate is known as the starting point for bus trips and is a significant symbol of Hakone. It marks the entrance to the sacred precinct, with a stone Jizo statue nearby. The area is particularly stunning in autumn when the red leaves add to its beauty. Visitors should be cautious of vehicles when taking photos, and it's advisable to dress warmly during colder seasons.
name: Hakone Shrine 1st Torii Gate
address: 東海道 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

detail_description: Tonosawa is a charming hot-spring spa resort located along the railway route to Gora. The area is dotted with historic ryokan and hotels, some of which have been around for centuries, dating back to the time when they were situated on the old Tokaido Highway leading to Edo. The train makes several stops before reaching Gora, allowing visitors to explore this picturesque area. For a delightful lunch experience, Miyanoshita is recommended as the ideal spot.
name: Tonosawa
address: Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0315, Japan

detail_description: Hakone Craft House offers a unique opportunity to immerse yourself in traditional Japanese crafts. Visitors can participate in hands-on workshops where they can create their own works of art. The facility provides various experiences such as glassblowing, sandblasting, and pottery making. Even for English speakers with limited Japanese knowledge, it's easy to join the classes and the staff are attentive and helpful.
name: Hakone Craft House
address: 箱根強羅公園, 内, 1300 Gora, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0408, Japan

excerpt: Red-painted Shinto site honoring the nine-headed dragon once said to live in adjoining Lake Ashi.
detail_description: Kuzuryu Shrine Shingu, also known as the Nine-Headed-Dragon Shrine, is a vibrant red Shinto site located near Lake Ashi in Hakone. Legend has it that a monk subdued a nine-headed dragon that demanded human sacrifices from villagers, leading to the shrine's establishment in 757. This historical power spot is believed to bring good luck, prosperity, and improved fortune. It's particularly popular with women who come to pray for love and successful marriages.
name: Kuzuryu Shrine Shingu
address: 80-1 Motohakone, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa 250-0522, Japan

excerpt: Boasting open views of Mount Fuji, this 1,212 meter high mountain offers a popular, if steep, hike.
detail_description: Mount Ashigara, standing at 1,212 meters high in Kanagawa and Shizuoka prefectures within the Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, is a popular destination for hikers seeking stunning views of Mount Fuji. The hike to the summit can be challenging but offers rewarding panoramic vistas. Hiking poles are recommended for those less experienced, as the trail consists of stairs and uneven rocky terrain with an elevation gain of around 480-500m from Kintoki Shrine.
name: Mount Ashigara
address: Kuwagi, Oyama, Sunto District, Shizuoka 410-1315, Japan
